senses.de: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.
senses.ex: Her success in school was great.

Tips.title: Goal Oriented
Tips.description: Use 'success' to highlight the completion of goals, not just the attempt or effort.
Tips.example: Her study plan was a success; she passed all her exams.

Tips.title: Measurable Achievements
Tips.description: 'Success' often implies a measurable or visible outcome from someone's actions.
Tips.example: Winning the science fair was a huge success for him.

senses.de: A person or thing that achieves desired aims or attains prosperity.
senses.ex: Color television is one of the 20th Century's great successes.

Tips.title: Qualifier Needed
Tips.description: 'Success' used for people or things often requires qualifiers like 'great' or 'huge' to clarify its extent.
Tips.example: She became a great success in the art world.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Describing a person or thing as a 'success' usually infers a positive judgment or approval.
Tips.example: His first novel was a success and received many awards.

senses.de: The attainment of popularity or profit.
senses.ex: The success of his business was very rewarding

Tips.title: Beyond Money
Tips.description: Success in terms of popularity or profit can also apply to ideas, such as campaigns or shows.
Tips.example: The charity’s campaign was a success, gaining widespread support.

Tips.title: Relative Perspective
Tips.description: What counts as 'success' can vary greatly from person to person, depending on their objectives.
Tips.example: For a small business, simply breaking even can be a success.

senses.ex: The success of the treatment was greater than expected.

Tips.title: Outcome Focused
Tips.description: In medical or technical fields, 'success' is often used to discuss outcomes of treatments or experiments.
Tips.example: The clinical trial had a 90% success rate.

Tips.title: Impersonal Contexts
Tips.description: Use 'success' in a neutral, objective context where personal feelings are less relevant.
Tips.example: The new software deployment was a success.

Accomplishment.wordDefinition:
Accomplishment refers to something that you have done or achieved, while success refers to achieving a goal or reaching a positive outcome in a particular area of life.

For example, you might feel a sense of accomplishment after finishing a difficult project, whereas success might be measured in terms of achieving a certain grade on an exam or winning a competition.

Accomplishment is more focused on feelings of personal satisfaction, while success is often measured by external standards or achievements.

Overall, both accomplishment and success are important for personal growth and development.

It's important to set goals and work towards achieving them, but it's also important to recognize and celebrate the smaller accomplishments along the way.

Achievement.wordDefinition:
Achievement connotes the accomplishment of a specific goal or task, while success implies overall prosperity and accomplishment.

Achievement is typically more qualitative, while success is more quantitative. For example, if someone achieves their goal of finishing a marathon, that is an achievement.

However, if that person has a successful career as a professional athlete, that is success. Achievements are more tangible and specific, while success is more subjective and overarching.

Both words can be applicable in different contexts: achievement in sports, education, or personal endeavors while success in finance, career, or overall happiness.

Attain.wordDefinition:
Attain means to achieve or reach a goal or objective, while success is the accomplishment or achievement of a desired outcome.

Attain is applicable in situations where you have set a specific goal and are working towards reaching it, while success can be used more generally to describe any positive outcome or achievement.

For example, you might attain a certain grade on a test, while success could refer to doing well overall in school or in life.

Fulfil.wordDefinition:
Fulfil means to satisfy a desire, need, or goal that one has set for oneself. It is related to personal satisfaction and achievement.

For instance, if you set a goal to learn a new skill and then do it successfully, you would say that you have fulfilled that goal.

In essence, fulfil is more internal and personal to you as an individual, whereas success is more external and social.

Prosperity.wordDefinition:
Prosperity refers to a state of being wealthy, healthy, and successful in all areas of life such as financial, social, and personal.

Prosperity is more focused on overall well-being while success is focused on accomplishing specific goals. Prosperity is applicable in all areas of life, while success is applicable in achieving specific goals.

Realization.wordDefinition:
Realization and success are two different concepts. Realization refers to the understanding or awareness of something, while success refers to achieving a desired outcome or goal.

Realization is applicable in situations where you have gained some knowledge or understanding about a particular topic or situation.

For example, if you have been struggling to understand a difficult concept in math and suddenly you have a realization about how it works, that would be considered a realization.

Realization refers to understanding or awareness, while success refers to achieving a goal or desired outcome.

Triumph.wordDefinition:
Success and triumph are both related to achieving a goal or overcoming an obstacle, but they have slightly different meanings.

Triumph is a more dramatic term that refers to a great victory or accomplishment, often achieved despite significant obstacles or challenges.

So while success can be applied to a wide range of achievements and goals, triumph is reserved for more exceptional accomplishments that involve overcoming significant barriers.

Victory.wordDefinition:
Success refers to achieving a particular goal or objective, whereas victory refers to winning a competition or battle.

Success can be achieved in various areas of life, such as business, education, or personal goals. Victory is typically used in the context of sports, politics, or military conflicts.

Success can be a personal achievement, while victory is often a collective accomplishment. So, someone can be successful in their career, but victory is attained by a winning team in a game or a war.

quotes.Text: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you're in control of your life. If you don't, life controls you.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Tony Robbins

quotes.Text: Your success, or lack of success, is your responsibility. Even when you have a chain of command that you don't like as well, its your responsibility to work with the up chain of command.
quotes.Title: American
quotes.Name: Jocko Willink

quotes.Text: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Warren Buffett

quotes.Text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.Text: Part of the secret of a success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mark Twain

quotes.Text: The relationships we have with people are extremely important to success on and off the job.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.Text: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
quotes.Title: German Theologian
quotes.Name: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.Text: If you wish to be a success in the world, promise everything, deliver nothing.
quotes.Title: French Statesman
quotes.Name: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.Text: Personality is the most important thing to an actress's success.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Mae West

quotes.Text: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
quotes.Title: Scottish Novelist
quotes.Name: Walter Scott
